segment.source: Step 1: Make sure your machine can run Hyper-V
segment.target: Step 1: Make sure your machine can run Hyper-V

segment.source: Only Windows 10 Pro and Windows 10 Enterprise support Hyper-V.
segment.target: Only Windows 10 Pro and Windows 10 Enterprise support Hyper-V.

segment.source: If you're running Windows 10 Home -- you can upgrade to Win 10 Pro in the Activation page located in the security settings.
segment.target: If you're running Windows 10 Home -- you can upgrade to Win 10 Pro in the Activation page located in the security settings.

segment.source: The "Go to store" link will take you to a page for upgrading.
segment.target: The "Go to store" link will take you to a page for upgrading.

segment.source: Hyper-V is not available in Windows 10 Mobile / Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise
segment.target: Hyper-V is not available in Windows 10 Mobile / Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise

segment.source: Hyper-V requires at least 4 GB of RAM but you might need more if you want to run multiple virtual machines at the same time.
segment.target: Hyper-V requires at least 4 GB of RAM but you might need more if you want to run multiple virtual machines at the same time.

segment.source: Starting in Windows 10, Hyper-V requires a 64-bit processor with Second Level Address Translation (SLAT).
segment.target: Starting in Windows 10, Hyper-V requires a 64-bit processor with Second Level Address Translation (SLAT).

segment.source: Verify hardware compatability
segment.target: Verify hardware compatability

segment.source: To verify compatability, open PowerShell or a Windows command prompt (cmd.exe) and type: systeminfo.exe.
segment.target: To verify compatability, open PowerShell or a Windows command prompt (cmd.exe) and type: systeminfo.exe.

segment.source: This will give you information about your computer.
segment.target: This will give you information about your computer.

segment.source: All of the items under Hyper-V Requirements must have the value if Yes.
segment.target: All of the items under Hyper-V Requirements must have the value if Yes.

segment.source: Relevant sections:
segment.target: Relevant sections:

segment.source: OS Name -- Must be Windows 8 or higher and either Profession or Enterprise.
segment.target: OS Name -- Must be Windows 8 or higher and either Profession or Enterprise.

segment.source: Hyper-V Requirements -- all of these must be true (value of "Yes") but some can be configured in BIOS.
segment.target: Hyper-V Requirements -- all of these must be true (value of "Yes") but some can be configured in BIOS.

segment.source: VM Monitor Mode Extensions -- Property of the hardware.
segment.target: VM Monitor Mode Extensions -- Property of the hardware.

segment.source: Hyper-V can not run on this machine.
segment.target: Hyper-V can not run on this machine.

segment.source: Virtualization Enabled in Firmware -- Can be enabled in BIOS
segment.target: Virtualization Enabled in Firmware -- Can be enabled in BIOS

segment.source: Second Level Address Translation -- Property of the hardware.
segment.target: Second Level Address Translation -- Property of the hardware.

segment.source: Hyper-V can not run on this machine.
segment.target: Hyper-V can not run on this machine.

segment.source: Data Execution Prevention Available -- Can be enabled in BIOS
segment.target: Data Execution Prevention Available -- Can be enabled in BIOS

segment.source: If Hyper-V is already enabled, the Hyper-V Requirements section will read:
segment.target: If Hyper-V is already enabled, the Hyper-V Requirements section will read:

segment.source: Next Step:
segment.target: Next Step:
